timeline.summary: On July 2, 2019, a Metropolitan Correctional Center Lieutenant documented daily operations, including counts, inmate observations (psychological observations, administrative detentions), equipment checks, and security procedures.  Counts were conducted at 12:00 AM, 3:00 AM, 5:00 AM, 6:00 AM, and 10:00 AM.  Various inmate movements occurred, including transfers, returns, and administrative detentions.  Phone calls were monitored, including WITSEC inquiries.  The shift involved responding to alarms, conducting trash runs, and managing visitation. The counts varied throughout the shift, starting at 796, decreasing to 783, and then increasing to 788 before the shift ended.

On July 08, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York reported daily activity. There were no significant incidents during the Morning Watch shift. The Day Watch shift noted a Fire Suppression System inoperative and initiated a fire watch. Staff shortages led to the vacating of Correctional assignments 10-South #2.  I/M Epstein #76318-054 was placed on Psychological Observation. New inmate admissions included Benjamin, Brown, Buchanan, Cabrera, Delacruz, Marshall, Ortiz, Quiroga, Roberson, and releases included Bignon, Delgado, Garcia, Kim, Mendoza, Pena, Reid, Richardson, Rivera, and Zamora.  A staff search was conducted due to missing reports and equipment. Leave utilized included various types such as furlough, annual leave, sick leave, and AWOL. Overtime was recorded for E-1, 60-Q (USM Medical), and other categories. The institution’s total population at the beginning of the morning shift was 790.

A psych observation was conducted on Jeffrey Edward Epstein, Reg. No. 73618-054, from July 8, 2019, at 6:00 PM to July 10, 2019, at 9:00 AM. An I/M companion was utilized during the observation.  Related documents, including a text file and a PDF, were attached.

This document is a psych observation report conducted from July 8, 2019, at 6:00 PM to July 10, 2019, at 9:00 AM, utilizing an inmate companion. The report was generated by the Associate Warden at MCC New York.  Attachments include a text file (.htm) and a PDF document (2019 08 12 15 18 11.pdf). The file identifier is EFTA00035223.

This document concerns a psych observation conducted on Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054) from July 8, 2019, at 6:00 PM to July 10, 2019, at 9:00 AM. The observation was performed by an "I/M companion," and the file (EFTA00035061) is corrupted and unopenable. Correspondence regarding the observation was exchanged between individuals with redacted email addresses.

A psych observation was conducted from July 8, 2019, at 6:00 PM to July 10, 2019, at 9:00 AM, utilizing an I/M companion. The observation took place at MCC New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007. The case file is designated CONFIDENTIAL and associated with SDNY_00010874 and EFTA00034378.

On July 9, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York documented daily operations, including counts, inventory checks, and inmate movements. Lieutenant’s logs recorded events such as fire alarm issues, body alarm testing, phone checks, and inmate placements in Administrative Detention, particularly for inmate I/M Epstein due to a psychological observation. There were several counts conducted throughout the shifts, with varying inmate totals. Specific incidents included inmate transfers to local hospitals, court appearances, and a trash run.  No STG/High Alert or WITSEC inquiries were recorded.

The document is a daily log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, detailing the activities and counts of July 9, 2019, under multiple shifts (Morning, Day, Evening). It records inmate movements, medical treatments, administrative detentions, phone calls monitored (including WITSEC inquiries), security checks (metal detectors, roof checks), and inmate counts. Specific inmates are tracked, including Epstein, Rivero, Barcliff, and Gebremariam, and their associated statuses (e.g., psych observation, hospital visits). The log also notes equipment issues (fire alarm, PREA announcement system) and changes in unit assignments.

On July 9, 2019, a Metropolitan Correctional Center Lieutenant documented daily operations, including counts, inmate movements (including psychiatric observations and administrative detentions), and security checks.  The shift involved monitoring phone calls (including STG and WITSEC inquiries), conducting inventory, responding to alarms, and managing inmate visits.  Counts varied throughout the day, with a final count of 792 at the end of the shift. Several inmates were transferred between units or facilities, and a trash run was conducted. The fire alarm/sprinkler system was intermittently nonoperational.

It details counts, inmate movements (including transfers to hospital, court, and administrative detention), equipment checks, phone monitoring (including WITSEC inquiries), and various institutional activities like feeding, trash collection, and visitation. There were issues with the fire alarm system, and several inmates were added or removed from the facility during the shift. The log recorded the times of various counts and shifts taken by the Lieutenant.
Inmate Epstein (#76318-054) is being placed on Psych Observation. The Suicide Watch status is None. This update was sent on July 9, 2019, at 12:33:16 PM.

On July 9, 2019, an update was sent regarding a Suicide Watch/Psych Observation for subject EFTA00035670. A subsequent Psych Observation was conducted on Epstein (#76318-054) and acknowledged with a thank you from EFTA00035671.

This document is a Suicide Watch/Psych Observation update regarding subject EFTA00035289. It includes a note regarding Epstein #76318-054 and a closing statement from a forensic observer (EFTA00035290).
Inmate ostein #76318-054 is being placed on Psych Observation. Darlene is being placed on Suicide Watch. The update is from [REDACTED] and dated July 9, 2019.
Inmate EFTA00035672 is under Suicide Watch and Psych Observation. Specifically, inmate Stein #76318-054 is under Psych Observation. The update was sent on July 9, 2019, from [REDACTED].

This document is a suicide watch/psych observation update, dated July 10, 2019, sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED]. It includes observations for two individuals: E stein #76318-054 and #79792-007 (Forensic). The document is classified as CONFIDENTIAL and includes the case ID SDNY_00009866.

On July 13, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) reported daily activity to the Warden and relevant staff. The Operations Lieutenant documented several shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening) noting staff shortages resulting in the vacating of SHU #2 and SHU #3. Inmates were observed under psychiatric observation with companions, and there were new admissions and releases. No cells in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) were triple-bunked. Staff leave included furloughs, sick leave, and a single AWOL incident. Overtime hours totaled 238, and the total number of staff on hand was 30. Initial institutional totals at 12:00 AM on July 13th showed various unit occupancies totaling 797.

Lieutenant’s shifts involved managing inmate activities, conducting counts, responding to alarms, and addressing issues like sprinkler malfunctions and bed space shortages. There were several inmate placements in administrative detention and ongoing monitoring of STG/High Alert phone calls and WITSEC inquiries. The counts varied throughout the day, with a final count of 799 recorded at the end of the shift.

On July 14, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) reported daily activity. There was no unusual activity during the morning watch shift. The day watch shift involved correctional assignments, a new inmate admission to BA, and vacated assignments due to staff shortages. The evening watch shift also had a staff shortage. Inmates were noted on psych observation, and there were no triple-bunked cells in the SHU. Leave usage included furlough, annual leave, sick leave, and a suspension. Overtime hours were recorded, totaling 241.00 hours across various categories. The institution’s total population at the beginning of the morning watch shift was 797.

Throughout the shifts, there were numerous institutional counts with varying results (798, 796, 785, 786, 787, 794, 77/5, 78/5, 76/5, 78/4, 79/5, 76/4). There were also issues with the PREA announcement system and a malfunctioning door panel.  No STG/High Alert or WITSEC phone calls were received. Visitation records were not available for this shift.

On July 23, 2019, an I/M companion performed duties from 7:00 am to 8:45 am on July 24, 2019. Epstein was transferred to psych observation from July 24, 2019, 8:45 am to July 30, 2019, 8:15 am, utilizing a companion.

On July 23, 2019, an update regarding a suicide watch was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] concerning subject Epstein #76318-054 (EFTA00035298). The update indicated no psych observations were noted.

A suicide watch observation was initiated for inmate Epstein #76318-054 on July 23, 2019. There were no psych observations. The communication was marked as confidential and referenced case numbers SDNY_00009884 and EFTA00034026.

On July 23, 2019, at 7:00 AM, an I/M companion assumed duties until July 24, 2019, at 8:45 AM. On July 23, 2019, at 7:00 AM, an “I/M companion” assumed duties from staff until July 24, 2019, at 8:45 AM.  David Epstein was transferred to psych observation from July 24, 2019, at 8:45 AM to July 30, 2019, at 8:15 AM, with the “I/M companion” utilized during this time. On July 23, 2019, an update regarding a Suicide Watch was initiated for subject Epstein #76318-054 (EFTA00035691). A subsequent Psych Observation report indicated no observations.

On July 23, 2019, at 7:00 AM, the I/M companion assumed duties until July 24, 2019, at 8:45 AM. Epstein was transferred to psych observation from July 24, 2019, at 8:45 AM to July 30, 2019, at 8:15 AM, with the I/M companion utilized.
A suicide watch observation was initiated for inmate Epstein #76318-054 on July 23, 2019. No psych observation was conducted. The update was sent from [REDACTED] and classified as CONFIDENTIAL.

On July 23, 2019, at 7:00 AM, an I/M companion assumed duties until July 24, 2019, at 8:45 AM. Epstein was transferred to psych observation from July 24, 2019, at 8:45 AM to July 30, 2019, at 8:15 AM, with a UM companion utilized.

On July 23, 2019, an I/M companion assumed duties from 7:00 AM to 8:45 AM. Epstein was transferred to psych observation from 8:45 AM on July 24, 2019, until 8:15 AM on July 30, 2019, with the I/M companion utilized during this time.

On July 23, 2019, an I/M companion performed duties from 7:00 AM to 8:45 AM on July 24, 2019. Epstein was transferred to psych observation from July 24, 2019, 8:45 AM to July 30, 2019, 8:15 AM, with a WM companion utilized.

On July 23, 2019, at 7:00 AM, an I/M companion assumed duties until July 24, 2019, at 8:45 AM. Epstein was transferred to psych observation from July 24, 2019, at 8:45 AM until July 30, 2019, at 8:15 AM, with the I/M companion utilized during this time.
On July 23, 2019, an I/M companion performed duties from 7:00 AM to 8:45 AM. Epstein was transferred to psych observation from July 24, 2019, 8:45 AM to July 30, 2019, utilizing a UM companion.

A suicide watch observation was initiated for inmate Epstein #76318-054 on July 23, 2019.  No psych observation was conducted. The communication was marked confidential and referenced case numbers SDNY_00009872 and EFTA00034019.

On July 23, 2019, at 7:00 AM, an “I/M companion” assumed duties until July 24, 2019, at 8:45 AM.  Jeffrey Epstein was transferred to psych observation from July 24, 2019, at 8:45 AM until July 30, 2019, at 8:15 AM, with a VM companion utilized. The document is associated with EFTA00032995.

The shift began with a count of 774 inmates, with 71 in the SHU (Special Housing Unit), and various inmates in sensitive situations (hospital, psych observation, WITSEC inquiries).  Throughout the shift, there were numerous counts, phone checks, and responses to alarms. Several inmates were placed in Administrative Detention due to reasons including possession of a cell phone and suicide watch.  There were instances of inmates being transferred to and from local hospitals and special housing units. The log records specific events like trash runs and visitation. The count ended at 770 with 75 inmates in the SHU.

On July 25, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center’s Lieutenant documented daily operations, including counts, inmate movements (e.g., Town Driver exit, inmate transfers to/from hospitals), and security checks. Sensitive information included inmate observations (psychiatric, suicide watch), phone calls monitored (including WITSEC inquiries), and administrative detentions (primarily related to cell phone possession).  Fire alarm system malfunctions were reported. Counts were conducted multiple times throughout the shifts, and various operational tasks, such as equipment inventories, phone checks, and trash runs, were performed. The log recorded changes in inmate status and location, totaling a fluctuating count of 774, 773, and 771 across the three shifts.

On July 25, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center’s Lieutenant documented daily operations, including counts, inmate movements (e.g., court appearances, transfers to nursing facilities or special housing), and maintenance issues (fire alarm malfunctions, equipment inventory). Several inmates were under observation (Psych Obs, Suicide Watch), and some were placed in Administrative Detention due to various reasons, including possession of cell phones. Phone calls were monitored, including WITSEC inquiries. Counts were conducted at various times throughout the shift, and the shift ended with a final count of 770 inmates.

A suicide watch observation was initiated for patient Epstein #76318-054 on Thursday, July 25, 2019, at 11:46:22 AM. The observation was flagged as “Suicide Watch” and included a “Psych Observation” update. The case file is designated EFTA00034931 and categorized as CONFIDENTIAL, SDNY_00012911.

On July 25, 2019, a communication occurred between [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] regarding a “Suicide Watch/Psych Observation Update” concerning individual EFTA00035303. The communication included a note about “Psych Observation” for Epstein #76318-054 and a closing statement from EFTA00035304.

On July 26, 2019, the Associate Warden at MCC New York is concerned about a prisoner’s psychological observation (psych obs) status, specifically regarding a potential step-down from SW to psych obs. The Chief Psychologist is tasked with assessing the prisoner’s condition and notifying the RD (Regional Director). The Associate Warden intends to re-assess the prisoner after he completes showering and dressing to ensure the decision remains appropriate before an interview. The Chief Psychologist has received nominations for awards submitted by the Associate Warden.

*   **Initial Count:** The beginning count for the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York was 770 inmates. *   **Operational Issues:** Throughout the shifts, there were issues with the fire alarm system, the Institution Public Address System, and metal detectors, leading to delays and alternative methods of communication. *   **Inmate Status:** Several inmates were noted for specific observations, including I/M Epstein on psychiatric observation with a companion, Hossain in Special Housing Unit (pending classification), and Brown placed in administrative detention due to a threat assessment. *   **Counts & Changes:** Multiple institutional counts were conducted throughout the day, resulting in variations in inmate numbers. *   **Phone Calls & Alerts:** The log recorded monitoring of STG/High Alert phone calls and WITSEC inquiries. *   **Visitation:** Visitation data was recorded for both 9 South and 11 North units. *   **Final Count:** The final count at the end of the shifts was 770.

On July 26, 2019, the Chief Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York requested an assessment of an inmate (“he”) before an attorney visit, anticipating the inmate would be present throughout the day. The Associate Warden responded and stated they had checked on the inmate but he was in the shower. The Warden instructed the Psychologist to re-assess the inmate after he finished showering and dressing to confirm the psych observation remained appropriate, addressing concerns from Central Office regarding a potential step-down from psych observation to SW. The Psychologist also requested notification to the RD upon completion of the assessment and confirmed receipt of award nominations.

On July 26, 2019, the Chief Psychologist of the U.S. Department of Justice/Federal Bureau of Prisons at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York is coordinating an assessment of an inmate ("Epstein") regarding psychological observation. The psychologist is concerned about a previous evaluation and wants to confirm the appropriateness of a decision to step the inmate down from psychological observation to solitary confinement (SW). The psychologist is repeatedly checking on the inmate’s status, requesting updates on the assessment, and ensuring the relevant Regional Director is notified.  Award nominations were also being checked to ensure they were received.

On July 26, 2019, an Associate Warden at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York is requesting an assessment of an inmate’s psychological state before an attorney visit. The Chief Psychologist is coordinating with the Associate Warden and Central Office Psych to ensure the assessment is conducted and justified. The Chief Psychologist also received award nominations from the Associate Warden. A change in the nomination due date was discussed.

On July 26, 2019, the Chief Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York was communicating with the Associate Warden regarding Jeffrey Epstein’s psychological observation. The Chief Psychologist requested updates on Epstein’s assessment, specifically wanting to confirm his current status after concerns from Central Office about a potential downgrade from psych observation to SW. The Associate Warden reported on Epstein’s activities, including being in the shower, and assured the Chief Psychologist that he would revisit Epstein after he was ready. Additionally, the Chief Psychologist mentioned having received award nominations from the Associate Warden.

The Chief Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York is following up on concerns from Central Office regarding a patient’s psych obs status. The psychologist intends to re-assess the patient after he finishes showering and dressing to confirm the appropriateness of the recent step-down decision. The Associate Warden is being notified upon completion of the patient's assessment. Additionally, the psychologist confirms receipt of award nominations submitted during a previous absence.

On July 26, 2019, an individual (Ma) sent an email regarding a Suicide Watch update. The Suicide Watch status was listed as “None.” A psych observation was noted for inmate Epstein #76318-054. The sender advised contacting the Supervisory Attorney, the institution at [phone number], or the Operations Lieutenant/Institution Duty Officer for immediate assistance due to being out of the office. The document is identified as EFTA00035276.

A request was made on July 26, 2019, regarding an inmate, #76318-054, and a broken toilet in cell #4 of the Psych Observation area at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The request instructed moving the inmate to a different cell upon his return from an Attorney Conference. The communication was sent by the Chief Psychologist of the U.S. Department of Justice/Federal Bureau of Prisons.

A suicide watch observation was initiated for patient Epstein (#76318-054) on July 26, 2019. The observation was flagged as a “Suicide Watch” and included a psych observation. The communication was classified as CONFIDENTIAL.

A suicide watch observation was initiated for inmate Epstein #76318-054 on July 26, 2019. The observation was noted as “None” regarding suicide watch, and a psych observation was conducted. The communication was flagged as confidential and referenced case numbers SDNY_00009906 and EFTA00034032.

This document is a Suicide Watch/Psych Observation Update regarding individual EFTA00035699. It includes a Psych Observation note for Epstein #76318-054, dated July 26, 2019, and sent from “To:”1 to EFTA00035699.

On July 27, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York documented daily operations, including counts, inmate movements, and security checks. Lieutenant’s logs recorded events such as fire alarm malfunctions, inmate placements (including those on psychiatric observation or in administrative detention), phone calls monitored (including WITSEC inquiries), and regular counts conducted at various times throughout the day. Specific inmates of note were Epstein and #76254-054. There were issues with the fire alarm system and a delay in conducting PREA announcements. Visitation records were also maintained, detailing adult and child inmate visits. The shifts transitioned between morning, day, evening, and mid-week watches.

On July 27, 2019, an assessment was conducted regarding inmate Epstein (#76318-054). The Suicide Watch status was None, and a Psych Observation was noted for Epstein. The communication was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED].

On July 27, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York reported daily activity, primarily focusing on fire watch incidents across multiple shifts. Staff shortages resulted in unassigned correctional officer assignments. Inmates were monitored in various observation and restriction settings (Psych Observation, Suicide Watch, SHU). There were no new or released admissions or adoptions to the Special Housing Unit. Leave utilization included various types of time off, and overtime hours were recorded for multiple staff categories. Cell occupancy was detailed, with a total of 767 cells occupied across various units.

A suicide watch observation was initiated for patient Epstein #76318-054 on 07/27/2019. The observation was categorized as "Suicide Watch" with a "Psych Observation" update. The communication was sent from [REDACTED] and classified as CONFIDENTIAL.  The case number associated with the observation is SDNY_00010159 and EFTA00034108.

An email was sent from EFTA00035701 to [REDACTED] regarding inmate #76318-054 in the Psych Observation area. The email indicates a potential issue with the toilet in cell #4 and requests a transfer to a different cell upon the inmate’s return from an Attorney Conference.

On July 28, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York reported daily activity through a memorandum to the Warden and relevant staff. Key events included: *   Multiple fire watch assignments due to staff shortages. *   An inmate transferred to special housing due to a fight on unit 7 South. *   An inmate transferred to the hospital for treatment and subsequently to special housing. *   Inmate Epstein was on psych observation with a companion. *   No new admissions or releases. *   No cells in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) were triple-bunked. *   No missing reports or equipment were noted. *   23 staff members worked 165.15 hours in E-1 overtime. *   2 staff members worked 16 hours in E-1 comp time. *   Staff totals at the beginning of the morning watch were 767.

On July 28, 2019, multiple individuals reported concerns regarding inmate Epstein (#76318-054). These concerns included: Epstein’s complaints about being in the Attorney Conference for extended periods without lunch and dinner; a toilet running for 45 minutes, causing distress; numbness in his right arm and neck; and a request for a move to another cell due to the toilet issue. Nurse saw him regarding the numbness. The inmate was initially under Suicide Watch and Psych Observation, which were subsequently removed. A pending bedspace request was made for SHU.
Inmate Epstein (#76318-054) is being removed from Psych Observation. The update was sent on July 28, 2019, regarding a Suicide Watch status of “None.”

Inmate Epstein reported numbness in his right arm and neck, along with difficulty making a fist. He also complained about a continuously running toilet in his cell. His Psych Observation was terminated. Inmate #20472-038 was removed from Psych Observation. A bed was pending in SHU for Epstein.

Inmate Epstein reported complaints regarding his cell environment, specifically requesting access to lunch and dinner instead of only a sandwich at 4:15 PM. He also expressed distress over being in the Attorney Conference from 8 AM to 8 PM daily. Furthermore, he reported a toilet malfunctioning, running for 45 minutes, leading him to urinate in a cup due to the aversive experience. He requested a move to another cell if the toilet issue persisted. Nurse observed numbness in his right arm and neck. His psych observation status was being reviewed and subsequently removed. Pending bedspace for SHU was noted.

Inmate Lopez #20472-038 is no longer under Suicide Watch or Psych Observation. Epstein #76318-054 remains under Psych Observation and is awaiting a bedspace in SHU. The update was sent on July 28, 2019, by [REDACTED].
Inmate Epstein (#76318-054) is being removed from Psych Observation. A bedspace is pending for inmate Lopez (#20472-038) in the SHU.

Inmate Epstein reported multiple issues on July 28, 2019. He complained about his work schedule, receiving only one meal, and the persistent running of a toilet in his cell for 45 minutes, leading him to urinate in a cup due to the disruptive and aversive experience. He also reported numbness in his right arm and neck. Inmate #20472-038 was removed from Psych Observation.

On July 28, 2019, multiple individuals reported concerns regarding inmate Epstein (#76318-054) who was under suicide watch and psych observation. These concerns included: *   Restrictions on his movement, specifically regarding access to the Attorney Conference. *   Lack of regular meals (sandwich at 4:15 PM, no lunch or dinner). *   A persistent issue with a toilet running for 45 minutes, causing distress and leading him to urinate in a cup. *   Reports of numbness in his right arm and neck. *   Inmate #20472-038 was removed from Psych Observation. Nurse observations documented Epstein’s complaints and actions taken, such as informing Nurse about the toilet issue.

On July 28, 2019, multiple individuals reported concerns regarding inmate Epstein (#76318-054). These concerns included: the inmate’s complaint about spending 12 hours daily in the Attorney Conference, receiving only one meal, and a persistent issue with a toilet running for 45 minutes; the inmate’s reported numbness in his right arm and neck; and a request to move him to a different cell due to the toilet issue. Inmate #20472-038 was removed from Psych Observation.

On July 28, 2019, at 7:49 AM GMT-05:00, an inmate, identified as Epstein #76318-054, was placed on Psych Observation. He reported numbness in his right arm and neck and difficulty making a fist. The toilet in his cell was running continuously for 45 minutes, causing distress. At 7:36 AM on the same day, he was removed from Suicide Watch and Psych Observation. A bed was pending for him.

On July 28, 2019, at 7:49 AM GMT-05:00, an update was sent regarding Inmate Epstein (#76318-054). He reported numbness in his right arm and neck, and difficulty making a fist. He also noted a persistent toilet issue.  Subsequently, at 7:36 AM, the same day, Inmate Epstein was removed from Suicide Watch and Psych Observation. A pending bed request for SHU was also noted.

An observation request was made regarding inmate Epstein (#76318-054) in the Psych Observation area, specifically concerning a potential issue with the toilet in cell #4. The request includes instructions to move him to a different cell upon his return from an Attorney Conference.

On July 28, 2019, inmate Epstein reported several issues, including being in the Attorney Conference from 8 AM to 8 PM daily with only one meal (a sandwich at 4:15 PM), a toilet running for 45 minutes, numbness in his right arm and neck, and difficulty making a fist. A nurse examined his arm, and he was taken off Suicide Watch and Psych Observation. A bed request for SHU was pending. Emails were sent to Mr. regarding the toilet issue.

On July 29, 2019, at 1:43 PM, the Chief Psychologist of the U.S. Department of Justice/Federal Bureau of Prisons requested a move for inmate Epstein (#76318-054) due to a broken toilet in his cell (#4 in the Psych Observation area). The request was made following a report on July 28, 2019, at 9:43 AM, to move the inmate to an adjacent cell pending repair of the toilet.

On July 30, 2019, a Metropolitan Correctional Center Lieutenant’s log documented daily operations, including counts, inmate movements (including hospital transfers and releases), security checks (metal detectors, restraint equipment, roof checks), and monitoring of phone calls (including WITSEC inquiries). The log recorded specific inmate activities, administrative detentions, and the operational status of various systems (fire alarm, public address system). Counts were conducted multiple times throughout the shifts, with variations in inmate numbers and locations. Visitation records were also maintained.

A suicide watch observation was initiated for patient Epstein (#76318-054) on July 30, 2019. The observation was categorized as “Suicide Watch” with a “Psych Observation” update. The communication was marked as confidential and referenced case numbers SDNY_00009892 and EFTA00034029.
Inmate #76318-054 is being removed from Psych Observation and requires a new cellmate. Suicide Watch status is cleared. The update was sent on July 30, 2019, from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED].
Inmate #76318-054 is being removed from Psych Observation and requires placement with an appropriate cellmate. Suicide Watch status is currently none.
Inmate Epstein (#76318-054) is being removed from Psych Observation and needs a cellmate. The Suicide Watch status is currently None.

On July 30, 2019, at 12:30 PM, an update was issued regarding Inmate Epstein (#76318-054), stating he was being removed from Psych Observation and needed a cellmate.  On August 13, 2019, a note indicated that there was no Suicide Watch or Psych Observation being conducted for this inmate.  On August 14, 2019, a series of emails were sent to 71 recipients with 27 acknowledgements and 44 responses pending, containing data regarding read status and transfer activity.  Attachments related to the inmate's case were included.

An inmate, identified as “Epstein,” requested a razor and water access in Attorney Conference due to dehydration. He reported a lack of medication due to being placed on Psych Observation, a 21-day sleep deprivation due to a missing CPAP machine, and a belief that SHU conditions (noise and banging) would cause psychological trauma, hindering his ability to utilize coping strategies from Turning Points handouts.

On August 3, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center’s Lieutenant documented daily operations, including counts, inmate movements (specifically Melendez and Benjamin), and security checks. Key events included fire alarm issues, phone checks, body alarm testing, PREA announcements, and administrative detentions. Inmates were frequently placed in the Local Hospital and observed psychological observations. Throughout the shift, the Lieutenant transitioned between morning, day, and evening watches, managing inmate counts and responding to various incidents, including a hospital return for inmate Melendez. There were no recorded STG/High Alert phone calls or WITSEC inquiries.

There were instances of inmates placed in Administrative Detention due to pending SIS investigations.  Specific inmate names and case numbers were recorded along with the reasons for detention.  The Lieutenant addressed sensitive information, including inmate observations (psych obs, suicide watch), monitored phone calls (STG/High Alert and WITSEC inquiries), and responded to system malfunctions (fire alarm, PA system). There were variations in the count throughout the shifts, with a final count of 759 on Sunday. Visitation details were recorded, including adult and child visitors.

On August 6, 2019, an update regarding a “Suicide Watch” (EFTA00036443) was generated. It included notes on a “Psych Observation” (EFTA00036444) with pending bed arrangements in SHU (Secure Housing Unit).

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] on August 6, 2019, regarding a “Suicide Watch/Psych Observation Update” for case EFTA00036517. The observation notes indicate “None” for the psych observation, and a thank you note is included from EFTA00036518.

This document is a Suicide Watch/Psych Observation update (EFTA00036368) from August 7, 2019. It notes the absence of specific details regarding both Suicide Watch and Psych Observation, as well as pending SHU beds. A final message expresses thanks.

This document pertains to a Suicide Watch/Psych Observation case, EFTA00036523, initiated on August 7, 2019. It includes updates on “None” for both Suicide Watch and Psych Observation, and notes the pending availability of SHU beds.

On August 8, 2019, an update regarding a Suicide Watch/Psych Observation was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED]. It concerns inmate file EFTA00036515. The observation includes Bright #76309-054, Benjamin #86463-054, Ramos #85428-054, and Almanzar #85978-054, all currently pending placement in a SHU bedspace.

Throughout the shift, there were several inmate movements, including transfers (TRTY TRANS), administrative detentions, and changes in observation status (suicide watch, psych observation, dry cell).  There were issues with the Institution Public Address System, the Rear Gate Metal Detector, and the Fire Alarm system. Several body alarm tests were conducted, and routine counts were performed at 12:00 AM, 3:00 AM, and 5:00 AM. Visitation records were also noted, with a total of 46 adults and children visiting. There were no STG/High Alert phone calls or WITSEC inquiries reported during the shift.

On August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, Lieutenant assumed duties at 12:00 AM. The daily count was 758 with 73 inmates in SHU.
